docs.lead_paragraph: Through the arts, education and other pursuits, more people are experiencing late-life rebirths that are rewarding creatively, emotionally and spiritually.

headline.main: Finding Success, Well Past the Age of Wunderkind
headline.print_headline: Finding Success, Well Past the Age of Wunderkind

docs.abstract: Retiring column; more and more retirees say that they are pursuing long-held dreams as they have gotten older, like Lucille Shulklapper, who began publishing poetry and children's stories in middle age.
docs.snippet: Through the arts, education and other pursuits, more people are experiencing late-life rebirths that are rewarding creatively, emotionally and spiritually.

docs.abstract: Discussion around the practice underscores the fact that the difficulties of bearing children and then raising them fall too often on individual women.

docs.lead_paragraph: Republican Scott Walker is cultivating an image on the nascent U.S. 2016 campaign trail as a regular guy who met his wife at a barbecue restaurant and buys discount clothes, a man-of-the-people approach that is in contrast to the more buttoned-down Jeb Bush.

docs.lead_paragraph: A Colorado woman accused of luring an expectant mother to a basement and cutting the baby from her belly might not face homicide charges in the child's death because of the way criminal law in the U.S. has become entangled in abortion politics.

headline.main: Attack on Pregnant Woman Complicated by Abortion Politics

docs.lead_paragraph: The gruesome case of a Colorado woman accused of cutting open the belly of a pregnant woman and removing her unborn baby girl is reviving the highly-charged debate over when a fetus can legally be considered a human being.

headline.main: Gruesome Colorado Case Sheds Light on Fetal Homicide Laws
headline.print_headline: Gruesome Colorado Case Sheds Light on Fetal Homicide Laws

docs.lead_paragraph: Three New York City departments are writing rules to govern what are called occupant-evacuation elevators — cars that can, in special circumstances, be used to move people down in an emergency.

headline.main: Considering a Counterintuitive Path to Escape a Fire: The Elevator
headline.print_headline: Considering a Counterintuitive Path to Escape a Fire: The Elevator

docs.abstract: David W Dunlap Building Blocks column observes that New York's Fire, Buildings and City Planning Depts are all writing rules to govern occupant-evacuation elevators, which are meant to move people down quickly in emergency; measures would upend decades of codes and practices based on idea that elevators are perilous in fires and other emergencies; shift was in part inspired by lives saved by elevators during Sept 11 attacks.
docs.snippet: Three New York City departments are writing rules to govern what are called occupant-evacuation elevators — cars that can, in special circumstances, be used to move people down in an emergency.

docs.lead_paragraph: Mental illness and a culture that prefers boys have been discussed as possible explanations after a woman killed her daughters.

headline.main: Puzzlement Over Killing of 3 Girls in Delhi

docs.abstract: Letter from India; case of Radha Devi, New Delhi mother who strangled her three daughters and then unsuccessfully tried to hang herself, has transfixed India as people speculate about her possible motivation and implications of the crime; investigation has revealed that Devi was under psychiatric treatment, but culture that values boys over girls has also been suggested as contributing factor.
docs.snippet: Mental illness and a culture that prefers boys have been discussed as possible explanations after a woman killed her daughters.
